{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has poorly controlled type 1 diabetes, which is a risk factor for several congenital abnormalities. Amelia is a severe birth defect where a baby is born missing one or more limbs, but it is not specifically associated with maternal diabetes. Spina bifida is a neural tube defect that can occur in any pregnancy, but it is not specifically associated with maternal diabetes. Ventricular septal defect is a heart defect that can occur in any pregnancy, but it is not specifically associated with maternal diabetes.
